title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 23
author: Various
snippet: Proceeding with the peculiarities: another of these was, that Mrs.Dodds, like her of Auchtermuchty, or Mrs. Grumlie, carried domesticityto devotion, scarcely anything in the world having any interest to hersoul save what was contained in the house--from Tammas, the chiefarticle of furniture, down, through the mahogany table, to theporridge-pot; clouting, mending, darning, cleaning, scouring, washing,scraping, wringing, drying, roasting, boiling, stewing, being all ofthem done with such duty, love, and intensity of purpose, that they wereveritable sacrifices to the _lares_.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 23

title: Bertie Plays the Blues
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: There's no doubt they come from Auchtermuchty, rather than the middle of the Atlantic somewhere.

title: Tales and sketches.
author: Miller, Hugh
snippet: Are you acquainted with ' The Gudewife of Auchtermuchty ? ' "

title: Memoirs of the life and writings of Thomas Chalmers...
author: Hanna, William
snippet: " In the case of Auchtermuchty,* where the Presbytery had wrongfully admitted another than the patron's presentee, the Court fuuud, ' That the right to a stipend is a civil right ; and therefore that the Court have power to cognosce and determine upon the legality of the admission of ministers in hunc efectum, whether the person admitted shall have right to the stipend or not ; and simply decided, that the patron was entitled to retain the stipend in his own hands.

title: Open the door,
author: Carswell, Catherine MacFarlane
snippet: It was still too early to start for Auchtermuchty.

title: Open the door,
author: Carswell, Catherine MacFarlane
snippet: She would cross it on her way to Auchtermuchty.

title: Open the door,
author: Carswell, Catherine MacFarlane
snippet: " Meet us at Auchtermuchty to-morrow," he said as she faltered into silence.

title: Open the door,
author: Carswell, Catherine MacFarlane
snippet: After having declared eagerly that she well knew Auchtermuchty,  Joanna discovered that she could tell Carl nothing definite about it.

title: Open the door,
author: Carswell, Catherine MacFarlane
snippet: Good! What now of the " ancient, royal burgh " of Auchtermuchty?

title: Open the door,
author: Carswell, Catherine MacFarlane
snippet: Lawrence was also to see them now for the first time. . . . Cupar, Falkland, Auchtermuchty, Strathmiglo! . . . such promising names as they had! Did Joanna know any of them?

title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: Quitting this interesting little town, which, fromits isolated situation, bids fair long to retain itsstate of pristine simplicity, we recrossed Stratheden to Auchtermuchty, whence we proceededalong the side of the valley, by the new road to Cupar-Fife, commanding an extensive view of therich and varied tract, abounding in villages andseats, interspersed with ornamental wood, andcrowned by the Lomond hills, popularly called " theHowe o' Fife," and watered by the Eden, whichnearly equally bisects the county, and forms theboundary to the north of the Coal Basin.
